Update Prior and Posterior Weights Given \(\pi_0\) and \(\pi_{alt}\)

Source: R/06_BF.R
fash_prior_posterior_update.Rd

This function updates the prior and posterior weights in a FASH model using the estimated proportion of null datasets (\(\pi_0\)) and the reweighted prior under the alternative hypothesis (\(\pi_{alt}\)).

fash_prior_posterior_update(L_matrix, pi0, pi_alt, grid)

Arguments

L_matrix

A numeric matrix representing the log-likelihoods of datasets across mixture components. Rows correspond to datasets, and columns correspond to mixture components.

pi0

A numeric scalar representing the estimated proportion of null datasets.

pi_alt

A numeric vector representing the estimated weights of the alternative components.

grid

A numeric vector representing the grid of Predictive Standard Deviation (PSD) values.

Value

A list containing:

prior_weight

A data frame with two columns:

psd

A numeric vector of PSD values corresponding to non-trivial weights.

prior_weight

A numeric vector of prior weights corresponding to the PSD values.

posterior_weight

A numeric matrix of posterior weights, where rows correspond to datasets and columns correspond to non-trivial mixture components.

Examples

# Example usage:
L_matrix <- matrix(rnorm(50), nrow = 10, ncol = 5)
pi0_hat <- 0.8
pi_alt <- rep(0.2, 4)  # Alternative weights
grid <- seq(0, 2, length.out = 5)
update_result <- fash_prior_posterior_update(L_matrix, pi0_hat, pi_alt, grid)
#> Error in fash_prior_posterior_update(L_matrix, pi0_hat, pi_alt, grid): could not find function "fash_prior_posterior_update"

# View updated prior weights
print(update_result$prior_weight)
#> Error: object 'update_result' not found

# View updated posterior weights
print(update_result$posterior_weight)
#> Error: object 'update_result' not found
